name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
ingredients: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente; reserve 1 cup cooking water.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute (do not brown).
Stir in red pepper flakes and lemon zest; cook 30 seconds.
Add cooked spaghetti, toss to coat, adding reserved water a little at a time to create a light sauce.
Season with salt and pepper, stir in parsley, and serve immediately.

name: Classic Chicken Curry
ingredients: 800 g bone-in chicken thighs, cut into pieces
steps: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat; add onion and sauté until golden.
Add garlic and ginger; cook 1 minute.
Stir in curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder; toast 30 seconds.
Add chicken pieces; brown on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Mix in tomato puree and yogurt; simmer 2 minutes.
Pour in water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover. Simmer 25-30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Season with salt, garnish with cilantro, and serve with rice or naan.

name: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
steps: Blend avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla, and salt in a food processor until smooth.
Taste and adjust sweetness if needed.
Divide into serving glasses, chill 15 minutes.
Top with chocolate shavings before serving.

name: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 400 g kidney beans, drained and rinsed
400 g black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add onion, garlic, bell pepper, carrot, and celery. Sauté until softened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, and smoked paprika; cook 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes, beans, and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 25-30 minutes to thicken.
Season with salt, pepper, and lime juice. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: Pan-Seared Salmon with Lemon Butter
steps: Pat salmon dry and season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place salmon skin-side up and sear 4 minutes.
Flip and cook 3-4 minutes until desired doneness. Remove salmon and keep warm.
Reduce heat to medium, add butter and garlic, cook 30 seconds, then stir in lemon juice and parsley.
Spoon sauce over salmon and serve.

name: Oatmeal Banana Pancakes (Vegan)
steps: Blend oats to a flour in a blender. Add bananas, plant milk, baking powder, vanilla, and salt; blend to a smooth batter.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add a little coconut oil.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake, cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook 1-2 minutes more.
Serve with fruit, maple syrup, or nut butter.

name: Greek Salad with Feta
steps: Combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives in a salad bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar, sprinkle oregano, salt, and pepper; toss gently.
Top with crumbled feta and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Beef Stir-Fry with Broccoli
steps: Toss sliced beef with half the soy sauce and cornstarch; let marinate 10 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Stir-fry beef until browned; remove.
Add broccoli and a splash of water; stir-fry until bright green and tender-crisp, about 4 minutes.
Return beef to wok. Add remaining soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger; toss to coat and heat through.
Drizzle sesame oil, garnish with green onions, and serve with rice.

name: Lentil Soup
steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté until softened, 6-8 minutes.
Add garlic and cumin; cook 1 minute.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf, season with salt and pepper, stir in parsley, and serve.

name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Cream butter and sugars until light. Beat in egg and vanilla.
Whisk flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually mix into wet ingredients.
Fold in chocolate chips. Drop tablespoon-sized portions onto sheets.
Bake 9-11 minutes until edges are golden. Cool on racks.
